target.name: compileaaw
target.description: Compile all 'xbn' java code, As A Whole.

target.name: compilehelp
target.echo:
To avoid circular dependencies, compilation is done one-file-at-a-time. An alternative is 'compileaaw', which compiles everything simultaneously.
ReplaceAllGitOnlySandboxIndentTabsWithSpaces is used only by me (Jeff Epstein, the creator of XBN-Java). I use two separate sandboxes: - main: Where I do my work, and in which all source code is tab-indented. This contains temp files and other stuff hard-coded to my setup, such as Windows "*.lnk" shortcuts. This directory is not committed to GitHub. - gitonly: The directory committed to GitHub. I do no work in this directory. The source code in this is three-space delimited (after running ReplaceAllGitOnlySandboxIndentTabsWithSpaces on it, which is around 95% faster than ant's replaceregexp, using Java 1.7). This also contains all git-related files, which are never altered by this build process: The ".git" directory and other ".git" files.
To compile all (non-example/non-testing) code: - YOU only need to execute 'ant pubprecodelet' in order to compile all classes - *I* need to do the following -In the main sandbox (all three of these tasks are called by 'pubpretabs', which in my main sandbox only): -1- refresh -2- compileproper -3- gitonlyfill (only in my main sandbox. Calls ReplaceAllGitOnlySandboxIndentTabsWithSpaces) -In the git-only sandbox: -4- pubposttabs
The compileproper list originates in XBN-Java/z_build/ant_sub_files/compile.xml and is required by Template Featherweight/z_build/ant_sub_files/compile.xml
Any changes to this list must be duplicated to Template Featherweight.

target.name: compileproper
target.description: Compile all 'xbn' java code (that does not depend on com.github.aliteralmind.codelet.*), sequentially, ONE CLASS AT A TIME. For ensuring no circular dependencies. See 'compilehelp'

target.name: compileproper2
target.description: For starting compilation in the middle of the list, when needed.

target.name: compilepostcodelet
target.description: Optionally copies the Codelet jar to 'jar_dependencies', and then compiles all classes that depend on it.
